About Us

SeqSero2

SeqSero2 is a tool used to predict the serotype of Salmonella isolates.

Inputs: fastq or fasta sequencing files. It is advised that you check the quality of your sequences using a tool like MicroRunQC prior to using this tool.

Outputs: SeqSero2 will create an output containing a table for each sequence uploaded detailing the O and H antigens coded for, the predicted identification of the Salmonella species, the predicted antigenic profile, the predicted serotype, potential inter-serotype contamination, if any, and any notes about the sequence, including whether the sequence uploaded does not align with Salmonella genomes.


This tutorial assumes that you have already imported sequencing files into a GalaxyTrakr history. If you need assistance with that task, please see this tutorial. It is advised that you check the quality of your sequences using a tool like MicroRunQC prior to using this tool

Once you have your data in your history, search for SeqSero2 in the search tools bar and select the SeqSero2 tool.

Select your chosen dataset type from the dropdown of the tool. If you have a dataset of the type selected, it will autopopulate in the next dropdown. If this is not the input you would like to use, use the dropdown to select the correct dataset.

For Analysis mode, allele mode was what was used to evaluate SeqSero2 by the GenomeTrakr team. Please contact us if you would like to discuss whether k-mer mode would be better for you.

Leave the dropdown for Algorithms for BWA mapping at the default, which is mem. This is the only algorithm for which SeqSero2 is currently optimized.

Once you are happy with the inputs, click Execute to run the tool.


Documentation for SeqSero2 can be found:

  • here on the GalaxyTrakr's GitHub page.
  • Zhang S, Y. Y., Jones MB, Zhang Z, Deatherage Kaiser BL, Dinsmore BA, Fitzgerald C, Fields PI, Deng X. (2015). Salmonella serotype determination utilizing high-throughput genome sequencing data. J Clin Microbiol. ASM. Retrieved from http://http://jcm.asm.org/content/early/2015/03/05/JCM.00323-15

This is where the video tutorial will live.


Download this txt file for the SRRs of the Salmonella sequences used in the video tutorial and use Faster Download and Extract FASTQ tool's List of SRA accession, one per line option under select input type to import the sequences from NCBI. You can then run SeqSero2 on the files, yielding the outputs in this zip file.
